title: ⚡ Morning Marketing Ideas - 8:00 AM
narrative: Objective truth wins markets. We prove coaching works with data, not promises.

ideas.title: Combine Data Storytelling — 'Before/After Player Cards'
ideas.why_now: Hudl owns game film. We own player development over time. Combines give us the baseline. Time to visualize the arc.
specific_targets: Club directors evaluating tools (LinkedIn, email outreach via affiliates)
Coaches on basketball coaching forums + APB coaching telegram groups
Parents tired of being told 'your kid improved' (no proof)

execution.asset_1: Design 3 player cards (mock data from real CourtLab early testers): 'Isaac — Week 1 Baseline → 6 Weeks Later'. Show: combine baseline (shot % / height / lateral speed) → real improvement arc. Visual before/after comparison.
execution.asset_2: Draft accompanying LinkedIn post (Michael): 'Coaches say 'your kid got better.' Parents ask 'how much?' We answer with data. Baseline. Weekly. No guessing. This is Isaac's 6-week arc at [Club].' (image carousel)
execution.asset_3: Email template for outreach: Send to 10 interested coaches who haven't signed yet. Subject: 'See how one of our coaches proved player development (with data)'. Attach sample card + link to Lite playground.

ideas.why_works: Shows CourtLab does what Hudl can't: transformation proof. Parents pay fees for development; we show it. Coaches selling spots to parents suddenly have a killer asset.
ideas.why_competitors_miss: Hudl is about game film (what happened). We're about player development (what changed). Different conversation entirely.
blockers_and_fixes: Issue: Don't have clean player data yet
Fix: Use mock/redacted data from CourtLab pilot. Anonymise. Show trend shape, not names.
ideas.time_estimate: 45 mins (design 3 cards) + 30 mins (draft post + email) = 1.25 hours
ideas.next_step: Design cards in Figma → Post to LinkedIn → Deploy email to outreach list by 10 AM

ideas.title: ASA Proof of Concept — 'Data Discipline' Thought Leadership
ideas.why_now: We just proved (Feb 9) that keyword research is 80% wrong. That's a founder-level learning moment. Turn it into a Series B narrative.
specific_targets: Series B investors (blog post + LinkedIn + email)
Tech founder communities (ProductHunt, IndieHackers, Twitter tech)

execution.thought_piece: 1,200-word LinkedIn article: 'We spent $500 on bad keywords. Here's what $25/day of real data taught us.' Structure: (1) Gut theory (wrong), (2) Data reality (winners), (3) Lesson for coaches (distrust your instincts, trust live data). Frame as founder learning, not sales pitch.
execution.angle: Investors want to see: founder humility + data discipline + speed of iteration. This delivers all 3. Subtext: 'CourtLab founders think like coaches — we test assumptions, validate with real data, iterate fast.'
execution.tactical: Publish to LinkedIn + Medium + Cross-post to Twitter. Include ASA v2 strategy chart (sanitized). Tag 3-4 Series B investors + product founders. Email post to 5 investor intros in your pipeline.

ideas.why_works: Flips 'startup' narrative from 'we have the answer' to 'we learn by doing.' Builds trust with investors and coaches simultaneously.
ideas.supporting_data: ASA AU campaign: 0.91% initial CTR → refined to exact-match only → 5 proven keywords (basketball training 25%, basketball drills 50%). $25/day budget, expect <$12 CPA proof in Week 1.
ideas.next_step: Write draft by 9:30 AM → Michael review by 10 AM → Publish by 11 AM

ideas.title: Combine Event Marketing Sprint — 'Free Baseline Events as Anchor Strategy'
ideas.why_now: Feb is off-season for most SA clubs. Combine events are perfect now — low calendar conflict, coaches want baseline data before autumn season starts.
specific_targets: 10-15 district clubs in SA not yet signed (from CRM affiliate list)

execution.campaign_1: Email outreach (personalized): 'Free Combine Baseline + Reporting for [Club Name]'. Offer: 1x Combine event (2 hours), full baseline reporting in 72 hours, zero cost, no commitment. Only requirement: Club agrees to feedback call post-event. Target: 5 clubs, schedule for Feb 22-24.
execution.campaign_2: Phone/Telegram follow-up (coaches in APB coaching group): 'We're running free Combine baselines this month. Takes 2 hours. You get full player data + trends + parent-ready PDF. No strings. Interested?'
execution.campaign_3: Ad + social angle (secondary): Instagram carousel showing Combine energy + athlete excitement. Hook: 'Free combine baseline + data = coaches love it, parents understand their kid's progress.' Target: Parents following SA basketball clubs.

ideas.why_works: Combines are the 'demo' that makes CourtLab inevitable. Once a coach runs one and parents see the PDF, platform adoption becomes obvious. This is top-of-funnel but with proof.
ideas.expected_outcome: Run 5 events in Feb (5 clubs × $0 platform) → 5 clubs see baseline reporting + parent value → 4-5 of them become inbound leads for Year 1 contract (convert by end of March).
blockers_and_fixes: Fix: Partner with 1-2 affiliates to co-deliver first events. Club provides space; Michael + affiliate run event + reporting.
ideas.time_estimate: 30 mins (email drafts) + 1 hour (phone outreach) + 30 mins (social content) = 2 hours
ideas.next_step: Draft outreach emails by 8:30 AM → Deploy by 9 AM → Phone calls 9:30-11 AM

execution_checklist: ✅ Idea 1 (Player Cards) — Feasible in 1.25 hours, low-cost design
✅ Idea 2 (ASA Thought Piece) — Feasible in 1.5 hours, high founder credibility ROI
✅ Idea 3 (Combine Events) — Feasible in 2 hours, direct pipeline impact
success_metrics: Player Cards: 10+ views + 2+ coach inquiries by EOD
ASA Thought Piece: 50+ views + 2+ investor/founder comments on LinkedIn
Combine Events: 2+ clubs scheduled for baseline events, 1+ email intro to new club director
sequencing: Start with Combine outreach (highest-ROI pipeline work) + ASA thought piece (founder brand) in parallel. Player cards can deploy afternoon if time allows.
ready_for_michael: All three ideas are execution-ready. No blocker approvals needed. Deploy and report.
